intro: Pyrrheima loddigesii var. minus, commonly known as the lesser pyrrheima, is a rare and lesser-known variant of the pyrrheima genus. It is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from pale pink to white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
